questions.text: A child presented with leukocoria and an intraocular mass, which on histopathological examination had the presence of Flexner-Wintersteiner rosettes. Which of the following is the likely diagnosis in the child? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Retinoblastoma is identified by leukocoria, an intraocular mass in children, and the presence of Flexner-Wintersteiner rosettes on histopathology, which are true rosettes specific to this diagnosis.

questions.text: An elderly man presents with rigidity and tremors. On examination, he has blank facial expressions. Which of the following drugs can be used to manage this condition? (NEET PG 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Selegiline

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Selegiline is a monoamine oxidase B (MAO-B) inhibitor that increases dopamine availability in the brain and is used to manage the motor symptoms of Parkinson's disease, such as rigidity and tremors.

questions.text: Which Reflex is responsible for tachycardia during right atrial distension? (NEET PG 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D. Bainbridge reflex

Explanation:

  • • Explanation
  • • Bainbridge reflex is a cardioaccelerator reflex that increases the heart rate when venous return is increased. Since this reflex arises from right atrium, it is also called right atrial reflex.
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option A. J Reflex : Apnea followed by rapid breathing, bradycardia, and hypotension due to J receptor (C-receptor, juxta-pulmonary capillary receptor) stimulation.
  • • Option A. J Reflex
  • • Option B. Cushing Reflex : Incorrect because the Cushing reflex involves increased blood pressure, bradycardia, and respiratory depression in response to increased intracranial pressure, not right atrial distension.
  • • Option B. Cushing Reflex
  • • Option C. Bezold-Jarisch Reflex : Bezold-Jarisch reflex is the reflex characterized by bradycardia and hypotension, caused by stimulation of chemoreceptors present in the wall of left ventricles by substances such as alkaloids. It is also called coronary chemoreflex. Vagal fibers form the afferent and efferent pathways of this reflex.
  • • Option C.
  • • Bezold-Jarisch Reflex

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Bainbridge reflex is responsible for inducing tachycardia in response to right atrial distension. It serves to adjust heart rate upward when venous return to the heart increases, ensuring optimal cardiac output and circulation efficiency.

questions.text: Preferable time for IUCD insertion in a 28-year-old woman who has just delivered a healthy newborn. It was a normal vaginal delivery. (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Up to 48 hours

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The most preferable time for IUCD insertion after a normal vaginal delivery is within the first 48 hours postpartum to take advantage of the naturally dilated cervix and minimize expulsion risk

questions.text: Identify the mask in the image below? ( NEET PG 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Non-rebreathing mask

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The non-rebreathing mask (NRBM) is an oxygen delivery device that provides high concentrations of oxygen, up to approximately 80%, and is characterized by a reservoir bag and one-way valves to ensure the inhalation of high-purity oxygen.
  • ➤ The non-rebreathing mask (NRBM) is an oxygen delivery device that provides high concentrations of oxygen, up to approximately 80%, and is characterized by a reservoir bag and one-way valves to ensure the inhalation of high-purity oxygen.

questions.text: A patient addressing from Delhi presents with fever, arthralgia, and extensive petechial rash for 3 days. Lab investigations revealed a hemoglobin of 9 g/dL, a white blood cell count of 9000 cells/mm3, a platelet count of 20000 cells/mm3, and a prolonged bleeding time. The clotting time was normal. What is the most likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Dengue

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The presence of fever, arthralgia, petechial rash, and significant thrombocytopenia in a patient from an area where dengue is endemic should prompt immediate consideration of dengue fever, with prompt initiation of supportive care and monitoring for potential complications such as DHF or DSS.

questions.text: Based on the agglutination test shown below, what is the blood group?(NEET PG 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C. O positive

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The absence of agglutination with anti-A and anti-B antibodies and the presence of agglutination with anti-Rh antibodies confirms the blood group as O positive. This means the individual's red blood cells lack A and B antigens but contain the Rh factor.

questions.text: What is the most common chemistry of gallstones among the following options? (NEET PG 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Crystalline cholesterol monohydrate

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Gallstones are crystalline formations that occur in the gallbladder due to the precipitation of substances found in bile. The most common type of gallstones are cholesterol stones, which account for about 80% of all gallstone cases. These stones primarily consist of crystalline cholesterol monohydrate.
  • • Types of Gallstones :
  • • Types of Gallstones
  • • Cholesterol Stones : These are the most prevalent type, made primarily of crystalline cholesterol monohydrate. They are often yellow-green and can vary in size from small grains to large stones. Pigment Stones : Comprising about 20% of gallstones, pigment stones are made of bilirubin and can be either black or brown. These are more likely to form in individuals with liver disease or hemolytic disorders. Mixed Stones : These stones contain both cholesterol and pigment components, and may also include calcium bilirubinate, which is a part of some pigment stones.
  • • Cholesterol Stones : These are the most prevalent type, made primarily of crystalline cholesterol monohydrate. They are often yellow-green and can vary in size from small grains to large stones.
  • • Cholesterol Stones
  • • Pigment Stones : Comprising about 20% of gallstones, pigment stones are made of bilirubin and can be either black or brown. These are more likely to form in individuals with liver disease or hemolytic disorders.
  • • Pigment Stones
  • • Mixed Stones : These stones contain both cholesterol and pigment components, and may also include calcium bilirubinate, which is a part of some pigment stones.
  • • Mixed Stones
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option B. Crystalline cholesterol dihydrate: This is not a common form of gallstones. Cholesterol stones typically form in the monohydrate crystalline structure rather than dihydrate.
  • • Option B. Crystalline cholesterol dihydrate:
  • • Option C. Amorphous cholesterol dihydrate: Gallstones are rarely composed of amorphous cholesterol, and the dihydrate form is not typical. The monohydrate crystalline form is the most common.
  • • Option C. Amorphous cholesterol dihydrate:
  • • Option D. Amorphous cholesterol monohydrate: Gallstones are generally crystalline in nature rather than amorphous. Crystalline cholesterol monohydrate is the most common form found in gallstones.
  • • Option D. Amorphous cholesterol monohydrate:

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The most common chemistry of gallstones is crystalline cholesterol monohydrate, which constitutes about 80% of all gallstone cases.

questions.text: A 25-year-old software engineer presented with fatigue and lethargy. He worked for 12-14 hours a day, and his diet pattern consisted predominantly of fast food with very little veggies and greens. Labs: Hb - 9, MCV 106. What is the likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. Folate deficiency

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Folate deficiency should be considered in patients with macrocytic anemia and poor dietary intake of vegetables and greens. This deficiency can cause fatigue and lethargy and is confirmed by a high MCV and dietary history.

questions.text: A pregnant lady with 34 weeks of amenorrhea has the following findings: LDH - 700 IU/L, platelets - 75,000/ mm3, serum bilirubin - 1.5 mg/dL, SGOT - 200 U/L, SGPT - 150 U/L, and BP - 140/96 mm Hg. Her coagulation profile and renal function tests are normal. What is the diagnosis? (NEET PG 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) HELLP syndrome

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ HELLP syndrome is characterized by hemolysis, elevated liver enzymes, and low platelet count. It is a severe form of preeclampsia and necessitates urgent medical intervention.
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 1809, Williams Obstetrics 26 th edition
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 1809, Williams Obstetrics 26 th edition

questions.text: A patient complains of neck stiffness and severe headache. The CT image shown below is suggestive of which of the following conditions?(NEET PG 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. Subarachnoid hemorrhage

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • The given clinical scenario of a patient presenting with neck stiffness and severe headache with CT showing blood in the basal cistern suggests towards the diagnosis of subarachnoid hemorrhage (SAH).
  • • CT showing blood in the basal cistern
  • • Subarachnoid hemorrhage (SAH) is an extra axial intracranial hemorrhage and denotes the presence of blood within the subarachnoid space. NCCT shows the hyperdense “star of death” appearance .
  • • extra axial intracranial hemorrhage
  • • “star of death” appearance
  • • The modified Fisher scale is a grading method for SAH as seen on non-contrast CT (NCCT). The Hunt and Hess scale is used to describe the severity of SAH and to predict survival.
  • • modified Fisher scale
  • • is a grading method for SAH as seen on
  • • non-contrast CT
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option A: Meningitis can also present with neck stiffness and headache. NCCT would be normal. CE-MRI shows thickened enhancing meninges .
  • • Option A:
  • • CE-MRI shows thickened enhancing meninges
  • • Option C: Intraparenchymal hemorrhage is acute accumulation of blood within the parenchyma of the brain and on CT scan a hyperdense collection of blood, often with surrounding hypodense edema.
  • • Option C:
  • • acute accumulation of blood within the parenchyma of the brain
  • • Option D: Hemorrhagic stroke is a broader classification and usually indicated IC bleed.
  • • Option D:
  • • broader classification

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Subarachnoid hemorrhage is a critical condition indicated by CT findings of blood in the subarachnoid space, presenting clinically with rapid onset headache and neck stiffness. It requires immediate medical attention and further evaluation with grading scales like the modified Fisher scale to assess severity and guide treatment.

questions.text: What is the site of lesion in Wernicke's hemianopic pupil?(NEET PG 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. Optic tract

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The lesion site for Wernicke's hemianopic pupil is the optic tract, which when damaged, leads to a characteristic pupillary response where the pupil does not react to light shown on the side of the retina corresponding to the damaged tract. This finding is indicative of a post-chiasmal visual pathway issue and is useful for localizing neurological damage in clinical assessments.

questions.text: A 33-year-old woman presents with complaints of progressive loss of vision in the right halves of both eyes. Where is the lesion located in the optic pathway? ( NEET PG 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Left optic tract

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Right homonymous hemianopia, characterized by loss of the right visual field in both eyes, is caused by a lesion in the left optic tract.

questions.text: Enzyme activated by a decrease in insulin: glucagon ratio is? (NEET PG 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Glucose 6-phosphatase

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Low insulin glucagon ratio means it is fasting state, as in fed state insulin is more. So in fasting state glucose-6-phosphatase will be active as this enzyme is involved in gluconeogenesis , which occurs during fasting. Phosphofructokinase is involved in glycolysis. PFK-1 is active in any situation and PFK-2 is active only in fed state. Glucokinase phosphorylates glucose in liver and pancreas, active in fed state and is induced by insulin. Hexokinase also phosphorylates glucose and is present in all cells of the body. It is active in any situation in body as it is a general enzyme to phosphorylate glucose.
  • ➤ Low insulin glucagon ratio means it is fasting state, as in fed state insulin is more. So in fasting state glucose-6-phosphatase will be active as this enzyme is involved in gluconeogenesis , which occurs during fasting.
  • ➤ So in fasting state glucose-6-phosphatase will be active as this enzyme is involved in gluconeogenesis
  • ➤ Phosphofructokinase is involved in glycolysis. PFK-1 is active in any situation and PFK-2 is active only in fed state.
  • ➤ Glucokinase phosphorylates glucose in liver and pancreas, active in fed state and is induced by insulin.
  • ➤ Hexokinase also phosphorylates glucose and is present in all cells of the body. It is active in any situation in body as it is a general enzyme to phosphorylate glucose.
  • ➤ Ref- Harper 31st ed pg – 137-138
  • ➤ Ref- Harper 31st ed pg – 137-138

questions.text: All-trans retinoic acid is used in the treatment of tumor that is associated with which of the following genetic aberrations? (NEET PG 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) PML-RARA

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ All-trans retinoic acid (ATRA) is used in the treatment of acute promyelocytic leukemia (APL), which is characterized by the PML-RARA fusion gene resulting from the t(15;17) translocation. This treatment promotes the differentiation of leukemic promyelocytes, improving clinical outcomes in APL patients.

questions.text: Components of Disaster cycle that can be included in the recovery phase are: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Response – Rehabilitation – Reconstruction

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The recovery phase of the disaster cycle includes the components of Response, Rehabilitation, and Reconstruction, which are essential for restoring the community post-disaster.

questions.text: Which of the following is the first step after fitting the pessary to check if the pessary is adequately retained? (NEET PG 2018)

options.label: A
options.text: Asking the patient to void and see if the pessary is in place

options.label: B
options.text: Seeing if the patient feels any discomfort, which means that the pessary is retained

options.label: C
options.text: Asking the patient to perform the Valsalva manuever and see if the pessary is in place

options.label: D
options.text: Being able to admit two fingers between the ring and the pessary

questions.correct_answer: C. Asking the patient to perform the Valsalva manuever and see if the pessary is in place
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Asking the patient to perform the Valsalva maneuver and see if the pessary is in place

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • A vaginal pessary is a device used to support the pelvic organs in women with uterovaginal prolapse who are either unfit for surgery or unwilling to undergo surgery. The fitting process involves several steps to ensure the pessary is comfortable and effective:
  • • Patient Preparation : The patient is positioned in the lithotomy position and should have an empty bladder and rectum. Vaginal Examination : An assessment of vaginal length and width is performed to estimate the appropriate pessary size. Insertion : The pessary is lubricated and inserted in a cephalad direction against the posterior vaginal wall. Placement Check : An index finger is directed into the posterior vaginal fornix to ensure the cervix is above the pessary, and the pessary should fit snugly against the vaginal walls without causing pain. Adequacy Check : The patient is asked to perform a Valsalva maneuver (forceful exhalation against a closed airway) to see if the pessary remains in place, ensuring it is not dislodged during increased intra-abdominal pressure. Functionality Check : The patient should be able to stand, walk, cough, and urinate without difficulty or discomfort.
  • • Patient Preparation : The patient is positioned in the lithotomy position and should have an empty bladder and rectum.
  • • Patient Preparation
  • • Vaginal Examination : An assessment of vaginal length and width is performed to estimate the appropriate pessary size.
  • • Vaginal Examination
  • • Insertion : The pessary is lubricated and inserted in a cephalad direction against the posterior vaginal wall.
  • • Insertion
  • • Placement Check : An index finger is directed into the posterior vaginal fornix to ensure the cervix is above the pessary, and the pessary should fit snugly against the vaginal walls without causing pain.
  • • Placement Check
  • • Adequacy Check : The patient is asked to perform a Valsalva maneuver (forceful exhalation against a closed airway) to see if the pessary remains in place, ensuring it is not dislodged during increased intra-abdominal pressure.
  • • Adequacy Check
  • • Functionality Check : The patient should be able to stand, walk, cough, and urinate without difficulty or discomfort.
  • • Functionality Check
  • • Other options:
  • • Other options:
  • • Option A. Asking the patient to void and see if the pessary is in place : While checking the ability to void is important, it is not the first step after fitting the pessary.
  • • Option A. Asking the patient to void and see if the pessary is in place
  • • Option B. Seeing if the patient feels any discomfort, which means that the pessary is retained : Patient comfort is crucial, but discomfort does not necessarily mean the pessary is adequately retained.
  • • Option B. Seeing if the patient feels any discomfort, which means that the pessary is retained
  • • Option D. Being able to admit two fingers between the ring and the pessary : This is not a standard method for checking the fit of a pessary.
  • • Option D. Being able to admit two fingers between the ring and the pessary

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ After fitting a pessary, the first step to check if it is adequately retained is to ask the patient to perform the Valsalva maneuver and see if the pessary remains in place.

questions.text: Which of the following statements is false regarding neutrophil extracellular trapping (NET)? (NEET PG 2022)

options.label: A
options.text: It is detected in blood during sepsis

options.label: B
options.text: It is produced in response to bacterial infection.

options.label: D
options.text: It is chromatin with antibacterial enzymes.

questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Mitochondrial DNA is seen

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Neutrophil extracellular traps (NETs) are networks of nuclear DNA from neutrophils combined with antimicrobial enzymes and peptides, produced in response to bacterial and fungal infections. They play a crucial role in trapping and neutralizing pathogens. The presence of mitochondrial DNA in NETs is incorrect, as NETs are composed of nuclear chromatin.

questions.text: Viral infection causing transient aplastic anemia is: (NEET PG 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Parvovirus B-19

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Parvovirus B19 infection targets erythroid cell lines, particularly the pronormoblast stage, and is known to cause transient aplastic anemia, particularly in patients with underlying hemolytic disorders, as well as other clinical manifestations such as erythema infectiosum, arthritis, and non-immune fetal hydrops.

questions.text: A patient from Uttar Pradesh presented with fever, pallor, and hepatosplenomegaly. Peripheral smear examination showed pancytopenia. Buffy coat examination showed macrophages laden with organisms with a kinetoplast. What is the vector for the likely disease? (NEET PG 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Sandfly

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Visceral leishmaniasis, caused by Leishmania donovani and transmitted by sandflies, is a severe systemic disease. Recognizing its epidemiology, clinical presentation, and diagnostic features is crucial for prompt diagnosis and treatment. Awareness and control of the vector, along with appropriate medical intervention, are essential in areas endemic for this disease.

questions.text: ASEPSIS wound scoring takes all of the following into consideration except: (NEET PG 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Induration

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The ASEPSIS wound scoring system does not include induration as a criterion. It focuses on factors like purulent and serous discharge, erythema, separation of deep tissue, additional treatments, bacterial isolation, and extended hospital stay to evaluate surgical site infections.

questions.text: Which cardiac chamber enlargement is seen in the case of mitral stenosis on chest X-ray initially? (NEET PG 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Left atrium

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Mitral stenosis primarily leads to enlargement of the left atrium as the initial response to increased pressure upstream of the stenotic mitral valve. Recognition of this early sign on a chest X-ray can be crucial for diagnosing and managing mitral stenosis effectively.

References:

  • ↳ Reference - Harrison/Cardiology/VHD

questions.text: Which of the following diseases have autosomal recessive inheritance? (NEET PG 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Albinism

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

questions.text: A patient presenting with bleeding gums and easy bruisability was diagnosed with scurvy. What is the biochemical basis of scurvy?(NEET PG 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Defective collagen formation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

questions.text: A 19-year-old youth was brought the casualty with a black eye following a fist fight. Which area of the orbit is most likely to have been fractured? (NEET PG 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D. Floor

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The floor of the orbit is the most likely site of fracture in cases of orbital blowout fractures resulting from blunt trauma, such as a fist fight. Key clinical features include enophthalmos, infraorbital nerve anesthesia, and diplopia. Imaging with X-rays and CT scans are crucial for diagnosis and surgical intervention may be required for severe cases.

questions.text: How is water collected for bacteriological examination during a disease outbreak? (NEET PG 2023)

options.label: A
options.text: Collect water from already leaking taps

options.label: B
options.text: Before collecting, let water flow for at least 1 minute

options.label: C
options.text: Water sample container is kept close to the tap avoid spillage

options.label: D
options.text: Collect from a gentle stream of water to avoid splashing

questions.correct_answer: D. Collect from a gentle stream of water to avoid splashing
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Collect from a gentle stream of water to avoid splashing

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ When collecting water for bacteriological examination during a disease outbreak, it is crucial to collect from a gentle stream of water to avoid splashing and potential contamination. This practice ensures the accuracy and reliability of the water sample.

questions.text: Stoss therapy is utilized for the treatment of which condition? (NEET PG 2015)
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Stoss therapy refers to the administration of a large single dose or a few divided doses of vitamin D for the rapid correction of vitamin D deficiency. This therapy is specifically designed for treating nutritional vitamin D deficiency rickets. It typically involves giving a high dose of vitamin D (typically 300,000-600,000 IU) as either a single dose or divided over a few days.
  • • The advantages of Stoss therapy include improved compliance (as it requires fewer doses) and rapid correction of deficiency. After the initial high-dose therapy, maintenance doses of vitamin D are continued to prevent recurrence. This approach is particularly useful in situations where compliance with daily supplementation might be challenging.
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option A. Scurvy - Incorrect. Scurvy is caused by vitamin C deficiency and is treated with vitamin C supplementation (100-200 mg/day for 3 months), not high-dose vitamin D therapy.
  • • Option A. Scurvy
  • • Option B. Keratomalacia - Incorrect. Keratomalacia is a condition resulting from severe vitamin A deficiency affecting the cornea. It requires vitamin A supplementation, not vitamin D. Treatment usually involves 200,000 IU of vitamin A orally on day 1, repeated on day 2 and after 2 weeks.
  • • Option B. Keratomalacia -
  • • Option D. Hypophosphatemic rickets - Incorrect. Hypophosphatemic rickets (vitamin D-resistant rickets) is typically hereditary and caused by phosphate wasting, not vitamin D deficiency. It is treated with phosphate supplements and calcitriol, not high-dose vitamin D therapy.
  • • Option D. Hypophosphatemic rickets

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Stoss therapy is specifically used for treating vitamin D deficiency rickets with large doses (300,000-600,000 IU) given over a short period, providing rapid correction and improved compliance compared to daily supplementation regimens.

questions.text: The temperature of a body of a deceased person is found to be 39 degrees Celsius. Which of the following is the most probable reason? ( NEET PG 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Septicaemia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Postmortem caloricity, where the body temperature remains elevated after death, can occur due to high body temperature before death, such as in cases of septicaemia, heat stroke, and certain poisonings, or due to very high environmental temperature.
  • ➤ Ref: Textbook of forensic medicine and toxicology, 5th edition, Krishan Vij, page 81
  • ➤ Ref: Textbook of forensic medicine and toxicology, 5th edition, Krishan Vij, page 81

questions.text: A toddler was found playing alone and was brought to the emergency department with complaints of difficulty in swallowing for the past few hours. An X-ray was performed, and the image revealed as shown in AP view. What is the diagnosis? (NEET PG 2021)

options.label: D
options.text: Soft tissue calcification in the neck

questions.correct_answer: B. Foreign body in the esophagus
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Foreign body in the esophagus

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of pediatric ingestion of foreign bodies, the esophagus is a common site where objects can become lodged. Radiographic evaluation typically shows a foreign body in the esophagus with a flat surface seen on the AP view and the edge on the lateral view. Immediate recognition and appropriate intervention are crucial to prevent complications.
  • ➤ In cases of pediatric ingestion of foreign bodies, the esophagus is a common site where objects can become lodged.
  • ➤ Radiographic evaluation typically shows a foreign body in the esophagus with a flat surface seen on the AP view and the edge on the lateral view.
  • ➤ Immediate recognition and appropriate intervention are crucial to prevent complications.

questions.text: Name the drug that acts on both the marked points: (NEET PG 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Omapatrilat

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Omapatrilat inhibits both neprilysin and angiotensin-converting enzyme, thereby decreasing angiotensin II and increasing natriuretic peptides, promoting natriuresis, diuresis, and vasodilation.

questions.text: A female presented with a long history of fever, discolored skin of lower limbs, and lower limb edema. Microscopic examination showed a sheathed organism with no nuclei at the tip of the tail. What can be the most likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For a patient presenting with symptoms of lymphatic filariasis and a sheathed microfilaria with no tail tip nuclei, Wuchereria bancrofti is the most likely diagnosis.

questions.text: A patient presenting with multiple humeral shaft fracture, following which he had difficulty in flexion of elbow and supination of forearm. He also complaints of loss of sensation over lateral side of forearm. Which nerve is damaged? (NEET PG 2021)
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Musculocutaneous nerve

questions.text: A boy born to a normal father and mother had Hemophilia. Detailed history taking revealed that the mother's side had a family history of similar affected individuals. The children born to this boy are likely to have which of the following? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: All boys and girl children equally affected

options.label: B
options.text: 50% boys affected and no girl children unaffected

options.label: C
options.text: No boy affected and 50% girl children are carrier

options.label: D
options.text: 25% boy affected and 25% girl children are carrier

questions.correct_answer: C. No boy affected and 50% girl children are carrier
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) No boy affected and 50% girl children are carrier

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In X-linked recessive disorders like hemophilia, affected males do not transmit the condition to their sons, but their daughters have a 50% chance of being carriers.

questions.text: Scenario with primary amenorrhea with secondary sexual characters present, uterus and ovaries present with an image as shown. What is the likely karyotype ? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 46 XX

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Primary amenorrhea with normal development of secondary sexual characteristics and intact internal female reproductive organs (uterus and ovaries) generally indicates a normal female karyotype, 46 XX.

questions.text: A patient with deep vein thrombosis was started on a new drug. After 2 days, he presented with the given finding. Which of the following drugs is implicated in causing the below condition? (NEET PG 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Warfarin

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Warfarin can cause dermal vascular necrosis, particularly in patients with protein C deficiency, presenting as painful, necrotic skin lesions shortly after initiation of therapy.

questions.text: Addison's disease can present with symptoms similar to which of the following disorders? (NEET PG 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Depression

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Addison's disease is due to hypofunctioning of the adrenocortical system. It can mimic depression due to overlapping symptoms such as fatigue, weight loss, and low mood. It is essential to consider medical conditions that can present similarly to psychiatric disorders to ensure accurate diagnosis and treatment.

References:

  • ↳ Reference: Kaplan & Sadock’s Comprehensive Textbook of Psychiatry, 10th edition, Page No 682.

questions.text: 100-day glaucoma is seen in which of the following conditions? ( NEET PG 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Central retinal vein occlusion

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Neovascular glaucoma, known as "100-day glaucoma," typically develops about three months after the onset of Central Retinal Vein Occlusion (CRVO) due to significant retinal ischemia and venous stasis leading to neovascularization.

questions.text: Which vitamin deficiency causes this?(NEET PG 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Niacin

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Niacin is another B-vitamin that is essential for various bodily functions. It plays a role in converting nutrients into energy, creating cholesterol and fats, repairing DNA, and acting as an antioxidant. Niacin is important for overall metabolic health. Severe niacin deficiency can lead to a condition called pellagra, which can have serious effects on the skin, digestive system, and nervous system.
  • ➤ Niacin deficiency can be caused by:
  • ➤ Dietary deficiency of tryptophan Dietary deficiency Vitamin B2 and B6 deficiency Carcinoid syndrome Hartnup’s disease
  • ➤ Dietary deficiency of tryptophan
  • ➤ Dietary deficiency Vitamin B2 and B6 deficiency
  • ➤ Carcinoid syndrome
  • ➤ Hartnup’s disease
  • ➤ Ref -Harper 31 st e/pg. 534-535
  • ➤ Ref -Harper 31 st e/pg. 534-535

questions.text: A patient came with complaints of vesicular oral lesions, and on skin sample, DIF showed a fishnet pattern as given below. What is the most likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Pemphigus vulgaris

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Pemphigus vulgaris is associated with a characteristic "fishnet" pattern on direct immunofluorescence due to IgG deposition along keratinocyte cell membranes. Recognizing this pattern is crucial for diagnosis.

questions.text: A veterinarian developed an ulcer with central black eschar over the forearm as shown in the image. Which of the following is the most probable causative organism? (NEET PG 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Bacillus anthracis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Cutaneous anthrax is characterized by the initial appearance of a small pimple that quickly turns into a painless ulcer with a necrotic (black) eschar at the center. This presentation is typical for individuals who have been in contact with infected animals or animal products, which is common in the veterinary profession.
  • ➤ Additional Information
  • ➤ Additional Information
  • ➤ Robert Koch validated the germ theory of disease after discovering the anthrax bacillus as the cause of anthrax. He also discovered the causative agents of tuberculosis and cholera. Hence, he is Known as the Father of Bacteriology.
  • ➤ Koch's postulates , which link specific microorganisms to specific diseases, state that the microorganism must be:
  • ➤ Koch's postulates
  • ➤ ﻿﻿﻿Found in abundance in diseased organisms, but not in healthy organisms. ﻿﻿﻿Isolated from a diseased organism and grown in pure culture ﻿﻿﻿Able to cause disease when inoculated into a healthy organism ﻿﻿﻿Re-isolated from the diseased experimental host and identical to the original specific causative agent
  • ➤ ﻿﻿﻿Found in abundance in diseased organisms, but not in healthy organisms.
  • ➤ ﻿﻿﻿Isolated from a diseased organism and grown in pure culture
  • ➤ ﻿﻿﻿Able to cause disease when inoculated into a healthy organism
  • ➤ ﻿﻿﻿Re-isolated from the diseased experimental host and identical to the original specific causative agent

questions.text: A 56-year-old man presents with fatigue, pallor, and abdominal pain. He reports memory loss and reveals that he works at a battery recycling plant. On examination, a noticeable foot drop in both lower extremities is seen. Laboratory testing shows elevated blood lead levels. Which enzyme is affected in the given scenario? (NEET PG 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Aminolevulinic acid (ALA) dehydratase

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ Lead poisoning primarily inhibits the enzyme Aminolevulinic acid (ALA) dehydratase (ALAD), leading to disruptions in the heme synthesis pathway and accumulation of heme precursors.

questions.text: What is the vector for the condition diagnosed by the image shown below? (NEET PG 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Sandfly

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The presence of Leishman-Donovan bodies inside macrophages is indicative of Kala Azar, a severe form of leishmaniasis transmitted by the bite of infected sandflies. Effective prevention and control are critical in endemic regions to reduce the transmission and impact of this disease.

questions.text: A 65-year-old female patient is brought to the ER in a state of unconsciousness. Her BP is 70/50 mm of Hg and her ECG is shown below. What is the next best step in the management of her condition? (NEET PG 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D. Synchronized cardioversion

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

questions.text: A patient comes to the emergency room with a history of multiple episodes of vomiting. After being administered an intravenous drug for treatment, he develops abnormal movements. Which of the following medications can be used to manage his abnormal movements? (NEET PG 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Benzhexol

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Benzhexol (trihexyphenidyl) is the drug of choice for managing extrapyramidal symptoms, which include abnormal movements induced by medications such as D2 receptor blockers.

questions.text: The shown epithelium is seen in: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Ureter

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Transitional epithelium, marked by umbrella cells and multilayered structure, is primarily found in the urinary tract, including the ureter, where it facilitates expansion and contraction.

questions.text: A child was brought with complaints of high fever, multiple seizures, headache, and neck rigidity. CSF analysis showed low glucose, high protein, and many polymorphs. The CSF culture showed pleomorphic gram-negative bacilli. What is true about the causative organism? (NEET PG 2023)

options.label: B
options.text: Produces non-lactose fermenting colonies on MacConkey agar

options.label: C
options.text: Exhibits satellitism around Staphylococcus aureus colonies

options.label: D
options.text: It exhibits alpha hemolysis on sheep blood agar

questions.correct_answer: C. Exhibits satellitism around Staphylococcus aureus colonies
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Exhibits satellitism around Staphylococcus aureus colonies

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of suspected Haemophilus influenzae infection, particularly meningitis, look for satellitism around Staphylococcus aureus on blood agar, indicating the organism's dependence on externally sourced V factor for growth.

questions.text: A pituitary tumor that overproduced growth hormone was surgically removed from a patient. The resection was discovered to be insufficient. What is the patient's first-line treatment? (NEET PG 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Octreotide

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Octreotide is used for the treatment of the following conditions: ( SOMAT ostatin)
  • ➤ Octreotide is used for the treatment of the following conditions: ( SOMAT ostatin)
  • ➤ SOMAT
  • ➤ S: S ecretory diarrhea due to carcinoid tumor, VIPomas, following cancer chemotherapy, AIDS etc.
  • ➤ S: S
  • ➤ O: O esophageal varices (Acute Variceal bleeding)
  • ➤ O: O
  • ➤ M: M alignancy like Insulinoma and Glucagonoma
  • ➤ M: M
  • ➤ A: A cromegaly due to GH secreting pituitary adenoma
  • ➤ A: A
  • ➤ T: T hyrotrope adenoma
  • ➤ T: T
  • ➤ Leuprolide, Goeserelin and Nafarelin are GnRH agonists.
  • ➤ Leuprolide, Goeserelin and Nafarelin are GnRH agonists.

questions.text: A woman presents to the OPD with complaints of amenorrhoea for the past year. She has a history of postpartum hemorrhage and lactational failure. What is the probable diagnosis? (NEET PG 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Sheehan’s syndrome

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Sheehan’s syndrome is characterized by postpartum hemorrhage leading to vascular thrombosis of the pituitary vessels, resulting in panhypopituitarism with symptoms like lactation failure and amenorrhea.
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 458, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Gynecology 6 th edition
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 458, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Gynecology 6 th edition

questions.text: A 3-year-old child was brought to the hospital with complaints of fever, rash and swelling of her hands and feet since past 5 days. There is desquamative skin rash, edema of hands and feet, erythema of palms and soles, oral erythema, and cervical lymphadenopathy. What is the likely condition? (NEET PG 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Kawasaki disease

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Kawasaki disease is characterized by a persistent fever, erythematous and polymorphous rash, edema of hands and feet, strawberry tongue, and cervical lymphadenopathy. It primarily affects children under 4 years old and can lead to serious coronary artery complications if not treated appropriately.

questions.text: A patient came to the hospital with complaints of lethargy, increased sleep, and weight gain. Investigations revealed low plasma TSH concentration. However, on the administration of TRH, the TSH levels increased. Which of the following conditions is likely in this patient? (NEET PG 2020)

options.label: A
options.text: Hyperthyroidism due to disease in the pituitary

options.label: B
options.text: Hypothyroidism due to disease in the pituitary

options.label: C
options.text: Hypothyroidism due to disease in the hypothalamus

options.label: D
options.text: Hyperthyroidism due to disease in the hypothalamus

questions.correct_answer: C. Hypothyroidism due to disease in the hypothalamus
questions.explanation:
Ans. C. Hypothyroidism due to disease in the hypothalamus

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ When evaluating a patient with hypothyroid symptoms and low TSH that responds to TRH administration, consider hypothalamic dysfunction as a probable cause. This is indicative of secondary hypothyroidism due to a lack of TRH production, affecting the pituitary’s secretion of TSH in the absence of exogenous stimulation.

References:

  • ↳ Reference - Harrison/Hypothyroidism/Chap 383
